result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael B Ellsworth was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: --The Court enters civil judgment against Mr. Ellsworth in the amount of $261 in favor of Andrew Broughton

--pay costs of $243 + $200 DNA Surcharge + $50 in subpoena fees= $493.00, due in $30 increments per month beginning 9/1/2015 and on the first day of the month thereafter until paid in full; non-payment results in a 30  day jail term with Huber privileges, consecutive

Per standing order, an assessment is added for 10% & 5% restitution surcharge.

--serve 30 days in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber/Work-Release privileges; to commence 8/14/2015 at 5:00pm

--The Court authorizes the transfer on this sentence to Dane Co. 

--provide DNA sample upon demand to designee

Case called at 10:23am [Clerk MO]
[Reserve Judge Neal Nettesheim presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Michael B Ellsworth in court with Attorney Karl Huebner. ADA Theresa A Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.

ADA Beck summarizes plea discussions/CCS
--Atty. Huebner agrees with summarization

Constitutional rights given; plea of "No Contest" entered; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, orders JOC entered.

Sentencing arguments given by ADA Beck
Sentencing arguments given by Atty. Huebner
Statement made by Mr. Ellsworth

The Court sentences Defendant to:
--serve 30 days in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber/Work-Release privileges; to commence 8/14/2015 at 5:00pm
--The Court authorizes the transfer on this sentence to Dane Co. 
--0 days credit for time already served given
--pay costs of $243 + $200 DNA Surcharge = $443 + $50 in subpoena fees= $493.00, due in $30 increments per month beginning 9/1/2015 and on the first day of the month thereafter until paid in full; non-payment results in a 30  day jail term with Huber privileges, consecutive
--provide DNA sample upon demand to designee
--The Court enters civil judgment against Mr. Ellsworth in the amount of $261 in favor of Andrew Broughton

Reserve Judge O'Brien presiding for Branch IV: 
[MK] case called at 9:48am. 
case called at Defendant Michael B Ellsworth in court with Attorney Karl Huebner.   ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited.
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint. 
Plea of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by the Defense

The Court requires $500 signature bond, with conditions: 
--no contact with Andrew Broughton
--no presence at Piggly Wiggly in Waterloo
--no discussion of the facts of the case with Nancy Smith
--to report to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Department for booking today.
recess 9:51am
